title: George Groves backs Josh Taylor to beat Regis Prograis and unify world titles

George Groves believes former training partner Josh Taylor will beat Regis Prograis and unify the super-lightweight division.

Scotsman Taylor and American Prograis clash in the final of the World Boxing Super Series in London on Saturday.

And Groves, who trained alongside Taylor under coach Shane McGuigan, has backed the home favourite to prevail.

"He's a great person to have in the gym because he’s so full of energy," he told Mirror Fighting's After The Bell .

"He does more shadow boxing before he puts his hand wraps on than I did in my entire camp!

"He’s got all the attributes you want as a fighter; he wants to have a fight, he has the energy, the desire and the ammunition - he ticks every box.

"While I was training he was considered a prospect; he was the hottest prospect we had and since he’s been in the tournament, he’s become a world champion and now he’s challenging for another belt.

"He's come a long way in a short space of time and improved fight on fight, it's great to see."

Taylor won his world title by beating Ivan Baranchyk while Prograis saw off Kiryl Relikh.

Both men are undefeated and the winner will walk away with the Muhammad Ali trophy as well as the two belts and $10million.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

And Groves has been impressed with what he's seen of Taylor.

"I watched his final spar and he looks in great shape," he added. "The fights are getting bigger, it's a unification and he’s in the final - is the occasion going to get to him? It hasn't so far.

"They've both done their media obligations and have both been looking for weaknesses and I haven't seen any in either of them.

"Josh Taylor is a phenomenal fighter; I've seen a lot more of him than I've seen of Prograis but I can't bet against him.

"I think this is his time; he has home advantage and that's a fantastic thing to have."
description: Taylor takes on fellow world super-lightweight world champion Prograis in London on Saturday
